result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ROBIN R HILL

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jeffrey Jensen

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ROBIN R HILL in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. If representation is not found in 30 days for the defendant, Court will appoint an attorney. Second appearance scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Warrant canceled/spoke to Adam from dispatch
Warrant canceled/spoke to Adam from dispatch

1:06 PM Defendant ROBIN R HILL in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Court notes the def does qualify for the public defender - they are just looking for an attorney to represent the defendant. Court sets Status Hearing for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 AM. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court reinstates the previous signature bond. 

Court adjourned at 1:08 PM
Second appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant called and stated she missed her court date yesterday and was looking to set something up so she could clear the warrant. I asked her why she missed court and she stated she forgot she had court and that also missed due to medical reasons. Def was given a court date of August 19, 2022 at 1:00 PM and was told this was a mandatory in person appearance. Def was told warrant would remain active until she was seen in court. Def was told to write down the court date as the mail wouldn't get to her in time.
Sent to GLSO on 08/17/22.

10:57 AM Defendant ROBIN R HILL not in court.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 10:57 AM
Second appearance on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant came to the office in person and stated she missed court this morning due to being in the hospital due to a bee sting. Def was given a new court date of August 16, 2022 at 10:00 AM. I asked the def if she had retained an attorney and she stated she had left messages at the Public defender's office but was still waiting for a phone call back. Def was told to continue to call the public defender's office. Def stated she understood. Def was given her notice of hearing.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ROBIN R HILL in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant - qualifies for PD representation and they will be appointing counsel. Court sets for Status of Counsel on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is ill and cannot make court appearance today.  Advised matter will be rescheduled and a notice will be mailed out.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

10:13 AM Defendant ROBIN R HILL in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis in court. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim on May 24, 2022 at 1:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:15 AM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
